text: Hi Stephanie, our demo reel looks good! I think the best piece is your second shot.
not sure what caused that but the image looks blurry, I understand it is not possible to have a 1080p render for the animation, bur even for 720p I do not think the image should be shaper
Probably you could check your depth of field and do not let it blur the overall image, and render a high sampling 1080p still put it in your website.
I will share some info to you that I shared with another student.

In the env 3d part, some of people they do everything, but most of them focus on certain areas. Please consider about you would like to focus on modeling/layout or texture/lookdev. (edited) 

<https://prospelamentors.slack.com/archives/CV5DL3H39/p1583912753024100|[12:45 AM]>
if you would like to concentrate on the modeling/layout part, you should more focus on env modeling such as maya hardsurface modeling, Houdini procedural modeling and houdini env scattering, speedtree would be a bounce as well.
<https://prospelamentors.slack.com/archives/CV5DL3H39/p1583912909026500|[12:48 AM]>
If you like the texture/lookdev phases, you can just focus on improve your technical and creative skills. you could choose substance painter or Mari, but it is good to know both to prove you could do textures for different scale of environments.
<https://prospelamentors.slack.com/archives/CV5DL3H39/p1583913114029800|[12:51 AM]>
In addition, it is good to learn Nuke and use it to composit your own demo reel to improve your work appearance and as a additional skill to be a good env artist.

In some studios such as ILM and DD, the env also responsible for env lighting. so basically as a 3d env artist you are a 3d generalist who knows everything from modeling to lighting, and you are an asset artist as well. Never only consider your elf as an env artist since there are not a lot of positons in the industry, and asset and env artists are sharing most of the skillset unless you are a specialist on one small area which is not the case for most of people.
